page.title: 15RALEIGH CYCLES
page.content: {T.I. Raleigh}is the world's largest producer and exporter of bicycles and wheeled toys. Raleigh has 90 years of history. It was founded in a small workshop with 12 men producing 3 cycles per week. Now they turn out 1 cycle every 12 seconds.{Frank Bowden, on the advice of a Doctor Gough began to build cycles in the mid 1800's. In 1888 he bought a small company in Raleigh Street and in 1896 the largest factory in the country, employing 850 workers, was built on a 7.5 acre site on{Faraday Road, Radford.}In 1902 Raleigh took over the{Sturmey Archer} company to make gears. By 1914 they were making 50,000 cycles/year. Further mergers: 1943-{Rudge Worth {Company;}1954-{Triumph Cycle Company; 1957-{BSA Cycle Company;}1960-{Carlton {Cycles.}1960 Raleigh was taken over by the{Tube Investment Group.}
